stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<ItemStock>
          • stock.Stock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ItemStock>, java.util.Collection<ItemStock>, java.util.List<ItemStock>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class Stock
extends java.util.ArrayList<ItemStock>
    A collection of items. Can be used for representing store inventory, stock orders, sales logs, and truck cargo
    Author:
    Daniel Field, Allen Basic
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()
        Construct the stock class.

    • Method Detail

      • addNewItem

        public ItemStock addNewItem(Item i,
                            int initialQuantity)
                     throws StockException
        Add a new item to the collection. This will only work if the item does not exist yet. This is not to be used for increasing the quantity (increaseQuantity does that).
        Parameters:
        i - Item to be added.
        initialQuantity - Initial quantity for the item.
        Returns:
        The newly created ItemStock object.
        Throws:
        StockException - Throws when the item already exists.

      • removeItem

        public boolean removeItem(int itemID)
        Remove an item from the collection. This will remove ALL of the stock for this item, including the item object itself. Do not use this for decreasing the quantity (decreaseQuantity does that).
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item to be removed.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether the item has been removed.

      • increaseQuantity

        public boolean increaseQuantity(int itemID,
                                int amount)
                         throws StockException
        Increase the quantity of the specified item.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item.
        amount - How much to increase the quantity by.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether the quantity was increased.
        Throws:
        StockException - Throws if stock is less than zero.

      • decreaseQuantity

        public boolean decreaseQuantity(int itemID,
                                int amount)
                         throws StockException
        Decrease the quantity of the specified item.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item.
        amount - How much to decrease the quantity by.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether the quantity was decreased.
        Throws:
        StockException - Throws if stock is less than zero.

      • getItemStock

        public ItemStock getItemStock(int itemID)
                       throws StockException
        Get an ItemStock by it's item ID.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item.
        Returns:
        The ItemStock object.
        Throws:
        StockException - Throw if the item does not exist.

      • getItemStock

        public ItemStock getItemStock(Item item)
                       throws StockException
        Get an ItemStock by it's item object.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item.
        Returns:
        The ItemStock object.
        Throws:
        StockException - Throw if the item does not exist.

      • getItemStock

        public ItemStock getItemStock(java.lang.String name)
                       throws StockException
        Get an ItemStock by it's item name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the item.
        Returns:
        The ItemStock object.
        Throws:
        StockException - Throw if the item does not exist.

      • uniqueItemCount

        public int uniqueItemCount()
        Get the number of unique items in the collection. This does not account for the quantity of each item.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of unique items.

      • stockTotal

        public int stockTotal()
        Total number of items in stock.
        Returns:
        The sum of the quantities of all of the items.

      • containsItem

        public boolean containsItem(Item i)
        Check whether an item is in the stock collection. This ignores quantity, so it will return true even if the quantity is zero.
        Parameters:
        i - Item for which to search.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value.

      • containsItem

        public boolean containsItem(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether an item is in the stock collection. This ignores quantity, so it will return true even if the quantity is zero.
        Parameters:
        name - Item name for which to search.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value.

      • containsItem

        public boolean containsItem(int itemID)
        Check whether an item is in the stock collection by checking the ID. This ignores quantity, so it will return true even if the quantity is zero.
        Parameters:
        itemID - The ID of the item.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value.
